quiz.title: Web Development Fundamentals
quiz.description: Basic concepts of web development including HTTP, browsers, and web technologies

question.explanation: HTTP stands for Hypertext Transfer Protocol, which is the foundation of data communication on the World Wide Web.

question.text: Which HTTP status code indicates a successful request?
question.explanation: HTTP status code 200 indicates that the request was successful and the server returned the requested resource.

question.text: What is the purpose of the DOM?

answers.answer: To provide a programming interface for HTML documents

question.explanation: The DOM (Document Object Model) provides a programming interface that allows scripts to dynamically access and update HTML documents.

question.text: Which of the following is NOT a semantic HTML element?
question.explanation: The <div> element is a generic container with no semantic meaning, while elements like header, nav, and article provide semantic structure.

Designing websites that respond to user input

question.explanation: Responsive web design is an approach that makes web pages render well on different devices and screen sizes using flexible layouts, images, and CSS media queries.
